item.title: Tutorials
item.description: Home/Tutorials Python tutorial LaTeX tutorial Widgets tutorial

item.title: Widgets
item.description: Home/Tutorials/Widgets You can find all my widgets on Binder, which processes the Jupyter Notebooks hosted on Github. Make widgets using nbinteract. Learn how here. My first widget, produces a histogram This widget processes strings

item.title: LaTeX
item.description:
Home/Tutorials/LaTeX Equations $$ ax^2 +bx+c=0 $$ https://gohugo.io/tutorials/mathjax/ -- With LaTeX you can write beautiful equations like $R_{\mu 
u} - {1 \over 2}g_{\mu 
u}\,R + g_{\mu 
u} \Lambda = {8 \pi G \over c^4} T_{\mu 
u}$ or $$ \phi = 1 + \cfrac{1}{1+ \cfrac{1}{1+\dotsb }}=  rac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2} $$ Learn more here. Presentation Make beautiful presentations using Beamer! Download a full working example of my favorite template [zip] [overleaf]. Browse the presentation below to get an idea.

item.title: Python
item.description: Home/Tutorials/Python Python is a great language for scientific computing, most of the programming done by our group is in python. We provide below some links for learning this language, and below we offer many python code examples. You are invited to download these codes, tweak with them, break them, hack them as you wish! Most codes focus on plotting, but other algorithms such as numerical integration and Fourier transforms can also be found.
